column4: Is there an easy way to remove all nvidia software on my ubuntu box (I upgraded the motherboard and the new video card is an ati so I no longer require the nvidia software)?
you can probably search for nvidia and select the packages to remove either in the software center or synaptic

hmm ok I was kinda hoping there was something shell based cause when I do the package manager it seems to ask me if I want to remove things like ubuntu-desktop? which I worry about not sure what that is?
don't remove it if it says it is going to remove ubuntu-desktop. that is like everything. basically. not just the invidia packages.
hold on a second and i'll see what i can do to answer your question.
did you install additional drivers in ubuntu or are you using the free ones?
i don't believe you can remove the Nouveau package. you can remove the unified NVIDIA drivers though...
maybe a better question is why do you want to remove these drivers?
well I am no longer using an nvidia card
and there is an option in the settings that makes reference to them
i wouldn't worry about it if it isn't negatively impacting you.

its not and i know I could just hide the menu item.  On that note when I do install the custom ati driver I get a warning about unsupported ati driver as a little image in the bottom right corner of the screen
you can disable the driver if you want to do that.
I have done that already (that removed the warning) and all seems to be working but I am not trying to do anything complicated either lol
go to system -> administration -> additional drivers (10.04)
i actually wanted to do what you are trying to do at one time to shrink the size of a ISO which contained a mini version of ubuntu. unfortunately the way things are packaged you just can't.
ok :) makes sense the driver it wants me to use is the ATI/AMD prop.. FGLRX graphics driver
